com.px100systems.data.plugin.storage.mongo

Class MongoDatabaseStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.px100systems.data.plugin.storage.mongo.MongoDatabaseStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TraditionalStorageProvider

    public class MongoDatabaseStorage
extends java.lang.Object
implements TraditionalStorageProvider
    MongoDB database storage provider. See TraditionalStorageProvider for details.

    Configuration
    • connectionUrl - expected to specify all Mongo connection parameters: host, port, database ("schema"), user/password, pool size, and other flags if needed
    Author:
    Alex Rogachevsky

      • search

        public <T> java.util.List<T> search(java.lang.String unitName,
                                    java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                    Criteria criteria,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy,
                                    java.lang.Integer limit)
        Description copied from interface: TraditionalStorageProvider
        Limited search within one entity/tenant i.e. "unit". Any multi-entity searches need to be correlated manually (like JDBC w/o joins). Works for both tarnsient and persisted units.
        Specified by:
        search in interface TraditionalStorageProvider
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class
        Parameters:
        unitName - unit name
        cls - bean class
        criteria - search criteria
        orderBy - - list of SQL-like strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        limit - mandatory limit
        Returns:
        the bean list

      • search

        public <T> EntityCursor<T> search(java.lang.String unitName,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                  Criteria criteria,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy)
        Description copied from interface: TraditionalStorageProvider
        Limitless search within one entity/tenant i.e. "unit". Any multi-entity searches need to be correlated manually (like JDBC w/o joins) Works for both tarnsient and persisted units.
        Specified by:
        search in interface TraditionalStorageProvider
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity class
        Parameters:
        unitName - a unit name is typically the entity name + tenantId
        cls - entity class - make sure the exact concrete class is specified and not a superclass
        criteria - filter - can be null to get all entities
        orderBy - - list of SQL-like strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        Returns:
        a closeable cursor (always use try/finally to close)

      • count

        Description copied from interface: TraditionalStorageProvider
        Provider-level count. Providers w/o native support should throw UnsupportedOperationException

      • save

        public void save(java.util.List<StoredBean> inserts,
                 java.util.List<StoredBean> updates,
                 java.util.List<Delete> deletes)
          throws DataStorageException
        Description copied from interface: TraditionalStorageProvider
        Transactionally save the data. Non-transactional providers like Mongo should manually rollback and rethrow the exception
        Specified by:
        save in interface TraditionalStorageProvider
        Parameters:
        inserts - a list of beans to insert
        updates - a list of changed beans to save
        deletes - a list of deletes - eitehr bean IDs or some Conditions to find and delete entities
        Throws:
        DataStorageException
